message.content:
cs.SI, cs.SOC, cs.DS, cs.IR, cs.CYBER. 

The paper deals with the problem of sensor placement in large scale online social networks (OSNs) for detecting and preventing rumor spreading. This problem involves selecting a small subset of items from a large population to maximize a set function, which is a subset selection problem. This problem is known to be NP-complete, which falls under the category of computational complexity theory (cs.CC). However, the paper proposes heuristics to find good solutions that trade off efficiency and accuracy, which falls under the category of artificial intelligence (cs.AI). The paper also uses graph sampling to obtain a candidate set of the underlying social network, which falls under the category of graph theory (cs.DS) and social networks (cs.SOC). The paper also discusses the effectiveness of detecting and predicting news outbreak, which falls under the category of information retrieval (cs.IR) and cybersecurity (cs.CYBER).
